alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Fairfield; Kershaw; Lexington; Newberry; Richland; Saluda; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 9:28PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Fairfield, southeastern Newberry, northern Calhoun, Lexington, west central Sumter, northeastern Saluda, Richland and southwestern Kershaw Counties through 1015 PM EDT... At 928 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Newberry to 6 miles north of Harbison State Forest to 9 miles west of Oakland. Movement was south at 15 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Murray Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Newberry, Springdale, Dentsville, Oak Grove, St. Andrews, VC Summer Nuclear Station, McEntire Air Base, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Red Bank, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Gaston, Prosperity and Arcadia Lakes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 45 and 87. Interstate 26 between mile markers 75 and 131. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 31. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
